intro: Barbosella dusenii, commonly known as the Dusen's barbosella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Mexico, specifically the Sierra Madre Occidental. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Barbosella dusenii is often found in open woodlands and scrublands, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
